title: Green Springs: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           No Physical Address  Louisa, VA 23093                 Directions         Green Springs National Historic Landmark District is privately owned, includes no public facilities, but is visible from public highways. It sits astride Route 15 in Louisa County, Virginia.  Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         No Public Access The land and buildings within the District are privately owned   Standard Hours    Sunday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Monday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Tuesday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Wednesday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Thursday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Friday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Saturday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM             Weather           Louisa County, Virginia enjoys a temperate climate with hot, humid summers and cool winters.          Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   No Entrance  - $0.00 The land and buildings within the District are privately owned.         Visitor Centers              Â    Green Springs National Historic Landmark District in Virginia's Piedmont encompasses over 14,000 acres. Its farmsteads offer a continuum of rural vernacular architecture in original context with minimal alteration. Landscapes and buildings, many predating the Civil War and connected to one another visually and through family relationships of early occupants, are today preserved through easements.
